content:
So.. I just finally finished a build on a new top-of-the-line linux desktop PC to replace my ageing MacBook Air at home. Figured a good torture test for how much faster it is would be to build the FHIR spec.

On my MacBook Air:
BUILD SUCCESSFUL Total time: 43 minutes 19 seconds

On my new machine:
BUILD SUCCESSFUL Total time: 4 minutes 48 seconds

Damn.
that's very fast indeed. a record, in fact. but do you need to clean out your temp?
Heh, decided not to go Mac this round. I've been waiting for about a year now for Apple to refresh the MacPro and I got sick of waiting. Back to Ubuntu for me!
It's a fresh checkout with all the .class files deleted, so no cleanup should be needed I think.
on your mac - clean ut your system temp, then it's a fair comparison
it can make a great deal of difference
if your temp has >150k files, windows as a whole starts to get slow.
OSX is a bit similar, I think
